content.body: so an `instanceof` check, you mean? that doesn't seem that useful; you can do that yourself
content.formatted_body: so an instanceof check, you mean? that doesn't seem that useful; you can do that yourself

so an instanceof check, you mean? that doesn't seem that useful; you can do that yourself

content.body: no, not an instanceof check, those are forgeable and don't work across realms. a brand check.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: no, not an instanceof check, those are forgeable and don't work across realms. a brand check.

content.body: ljharb: what brand do you imagine checking? there are a bunch of different built-in iterators in the language and the web platform, and they don't have a common brand
content.formatted_body: ljharb: what brand do you imagine checking? there are a bunch of different built-in iterators in the language and the web platform, and they don't have a common brand

ljharb: what brand do you imagine checking? there are a bunch of different built-in iterators in the language and the web platform, and they don't have a common brand

content.body: the whole point of iterator being an interface is that the interface is implemented by a bunch of different classes, including userland classes
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: the whole point of iterator being an interface is that the interface is implemented by a bunch of different classes, including userland classes

content.body: IMO the appropriate level for a brand check here would be to revert the whole Symbol.toStringTag change in the first place... what a bad idea of a feature. Not clear if it makes sense to "chip away at it" as much as I'm sympathetic with the idea to try.
